translated_text: Hunter Stud "Shining Paw" not yet... can you help me? are you looking for?<page>We also need meat. Hunter wants a lot. I burned it. Kebab. They are broken.<page>Oz's desire is getting stronger and stronger. more... Like brothers and sisters, sharp and strong.
secondary_translated_text: Hunter Stud "Shining Paw" n'est pas encore disponible Tu peux m'aider ? Vous cherchez ?<page>Nous avons aussi besoin de viande. Hunter veut beaucoup de choses. Je l'ai brûlé, Kebab. Ils sont brisés.<page>Le désir d'Oz devient de plus en plus fort. plus... Comme des frères et sœurs, forts et forts.

original_en_text: Well, aren’t you a sight! No, don’t tell me! You’re as odd as they come.<page>Your poise! Your form! Are you hunted? Pursued? The Citadel would see a fine prize in you.<hpage>It is as you say, madam. Veiled bugs brought me to your land. I seek them now, for answers.<page>Ha! Fierce too! These are bleak times, but a powerful stray like you could certainly cause some change.<page>Well then! I’ve no love for that holy caste, and I do worry for this kingdom’s ailing state. If you’re seeking to settle a score, perhaps I can lend some aid?
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧这模样！让我猜猜，你不是这里的虫吧？<page>这仪态！这身姿！你正被追杀？被通缉？圣堡肯定很重视你。<hpage>如你所言，女士。覆面虫将我带来此地，我正在寻找它们。<page>哈！还挺凶！现在外面乱得很，你这般强悍的浪客肯定能搅出点动静。<page>正好！我也讨厌那群圣徒，也忧心王国的灾祸。你要找他们算账的话，或许我能帮衬？
translated_text: Well, you are not a vision! no! no! don't tell me! Weird as they are.<page>your actions! Your form! are you being chased? tracking him? The castle treats you like a treasure.<hpage>Like you said, woman. The worm on the veil has taken me to your country. I'm looking for them and looking for answers.<page>yeah! And strongly! These are dark times, but a powerful ranger like you will certainly make a difference.<page>okay! okay! I do not love that sacred caste, and am concerned about the terrible state of the kingdom. Can you help me if I want a score?
secondary_translated_text: Vous n'êtes pas une vision ! Non ! ! Non ! ! Ne me dis pas ! Bizarre comme ils le sont.<page>Vos actions ! votre forme !Êtes-vous chassé ? Le traquer ? Le Château vous traite comme un trésor.<hpage>Comme tu l'as dit, femme. Le ver sur le voile m'a emmené dans votre pays. Je les cherche, je cherche des réponses.<page>Ouais ! Et fortement ! Ce sont des temps sombres, mais un ranger puissant comme vous fera certainement la différence.<page>OK ! OK ! Je n'aime pas cette caste sacrée, et je m'inquiète de l'état terrible du royaume. Pouvez-vous m'aider si je veux un score ?

original_en_text: Hunter... Shining claw... Do not killsss... Mine is ssshell thin. Taste is poor...<page>Me’sss born not like siblingsss, themsss large and hard... All themsss did feasted and flew.<hpage>I see it clear, child. The tall mother’s meat has fed the brood fresh hatched.<hpage>It was a common fate that found her. Too common, perhaps...<page>Gone... the mother, her meatsss... and lifesss... for siblingss strong... not for usss so small... Neverss for usss...
original_zh_text: 猎手……闪亮的爪子……别杀我……咝……我的壳薄……肉柴……<page>我生来不像其他兄弟姐妹……咝——他们甲壳又大又硬……吃饱就飞走了。<hpage>看出来了，小不点。你母亲把自己的肉喂给了其他刚破卵的孩子。<hpage>她命该如此。或许……这就是她的宿命……<page>没了……母亲，她的血肉……和生命……养壮了兄弟姐妹……咝……没我的份……永远没有……
translated_text: The Hunter's shining claws. Don't tell me you've lost weight. It tastes bad.<page>I was born like a brother or sister. They are big and hard. We all enjoyed the feast and flew away.<hpage>I can see clearly, son. The mother's meat was given to the newly hatched chicken.<hpage>Finding her is our common destiny. Maybe it's too ordinary.<page>I'm leaving... Mom, the meat. Life will never be our own.
secondary_translated_text: Les griffes brillantes du chasseur. Ne me dis pas que tu as perdu du poids.Ça goûte mal.<page>Je suis née comme un frère ou une sœur. Ils sont gros et durs. Nous avons tous apprécié la fête et nous sommes partis.<hpage>Je vois bien mon fils. La viande de la mère a été donnée au poulet nouvellement éclosé.<hpage>La trouver, c'est notre destinée commune. Peut - être est-ce trop ordinaire.<page>Je pars... Maman, la viande ! La vie ne sera jamais la nôtre.

original_en_text: Pale beast... bringing ruin... we had sensed it... you writing harsh our final fate...<page>If power... you come seeking... mine is faded.... mortal... time taken...<hpage>Great one, I come not to see you as you are, rather I would have you recall what you were, before the pale monarch, when once your heart beat bright and brave.<hpage>That beating heart I would take, though know my intent is worthy.<hpage>I seek it only to save these lands, to break them free from this fatal sickness born of thread and void.<page>Kcha! If you may... beast... If you can... Mine once was power... wild... proud...
original_zh_text: 苍白异兽……携灾而至……吾等早有预感……汝书写的，是斯卡尔的终章……<page>若力量……是汝所求……吾已衰微……凡躯……时日无多……<hpage>蚁后，我来此并非为了觐见，而是追忆您昔年的英姿。在苍白君主降临前，当您的英勇之心仍炽烈搏动之时。<hpage>我欲取得那份搏动之心，还请您相信我的初衷磊落。<hpage>只为拯救这片土地，斩断丝咒与虚空的腐毒。<page>喀嚓！……若汝能……异兽……若汝可……吾曾执掌……狂野……伟力……傲然……
translated_text: The white beast will bring destruction. We feel the cruelty of your writing, our ultimate destiny.<page>If you have the power you come to look for it, mine fade, ordinary people take time.<hpage>I have not come, great man, to see what kind of man you are, but to remind you of what kind of man you were once when your heart pulsed brightly and valiantly before the pale monarch.<hpage>I want to take away that beating heart, but I know my intentions are worth it.<hpage>To save this land from this deadly disease which the thread and the void produce, I have sought it.<page>stop it! If possible, beast. It used to be a force. Pride in the wild.
secondary_translated_text: La bête blanche apportera la destruction. Nous ressentons la cruauté de vos écrits, notre destin ultime.<page>Si vous avez le pouvoir, vous venez le chercher, le mien s'estompera, les gens ordinaires prennent du temps.<hpage>Je ne suis pas venu, grand homme, pour voir quel genre d'homme vous êtes, mais pour vous rappeler quel genre d'homme vous étiez autrefois, lorsque votre cœur battait de vif et de vaillant devant le pâle monarque.<hpage>Je veux enlever ce cœur qui bat, mais je sais que mes intentions en valent la peine.<hpage>Pour sauver cette terre de cette maladie mortelle que le fil et le vide produisent, je l'ai cherchée.<page>Arrêtez ! Si possible, la bête. C'était une force. Fierté dans la nature.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your land’s fate has turned too dire, child. I cannot delay now to help you in your growth.<page>Sssss... So huntersss live... kill... only for selvesss... same as siblings...
original_zh_text: <hpage>你们的这片土地危在旦夕，小不点。时间紧迫，我没法帮你长壮实了。<page>咝……猎手为了生存……而杀戮……只顾自己……和离我而去兄弟姐妹没什么两样……
translated_text: <hpage>My son, the fate of your land is becoming dreadful. You can't delay any longer to help your growth.<page>Heath's voice. Hunter was killed at the scene. Self-portraits only permitted. Like brothers and sisters.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Mon fils, le sort de ta terre devient terrible. Vous ne pouvez pas retarder plus longtemps pour aider votre croissance.<page>voix de Heath. Hunter a été tué sur la scène. Seuls les autoportraits sont autorisés Comme des frères et sœurs.

original_en_text: These fields are hot and harsh, a miserable place for we pilgrims, and just above are the dreary moors, a place once of abundance lost to falling silt and murky rain.<page>The lands in every direction punish us, but such is our test. Above it all, the Citadel shines, our destination and our reward...<page>I’ll make it there, you’ll see. I’ve easily earned my place in such a paradise.
original_zh_text: <page>再往上，是一片阴雨连绵的沼地，过去的丰饶都化作了泥泞。<page>凶险又容易迷失，是对朝圣者的试炼。而圣堡就在上方，既是终点亦是奖赏……<page>我肯定能抵达，等着瞧。入那乐园我当之无愧。
translated_text: These fields are hot and barren, and a miserable place for the pilgrims. Above it was a dull wasteland that had once lost its fertile land to silt and muddy rain.<page>Every land punishes us, but this is our test. " Above all, the castle shone in our destination and return.<page>I will get there and you will see it. It was easy to find a place in such a paradise.
secondary_translated_text: Ces champs sont chauds et stériles, et un endroit misérable pour les pèlerins. Au-dessus, il y avait un désert terne qui avait autrefois perdu ses terres fertiles à cause du limon et de la pluie boueuse.<page>Chaque pays nous punit, mais c'est notre test.« Par-dessus tout, le château brillait dans notre destination et notre retour.<page>Je vais y arriver et vous le verrez. Il était facile de trouver une place dans un tel paradis.

original_en_text: <hpage>Is this place your permanent home, sir, or do you only make camp?<page>We pilgrims have no home, there is only the path. We climb, and suffer, and are thusly judged.<page>I will linger here only a moment, for the sake of trade. Once I’ve gathered enough rosaries, I’ll be holy enough to ascend without fear.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生可是以此地为家，还是暂驻？<page>朝圣者居无定所，唯有攀登圣途。前路如何，谁能晓得。<page>我小憩片刻就会启程。等攒够念珠，自能无畏登顶。
translated_text: <hpage>Is this place your forever home? Or just camping?<page>The pilgrims have no home, they have a road. We climb, we suffer and we are judged.<page>For the trade, I'm only here for a while. When you gather enough of the Rosary, you become holy enough to stand up without fear.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Est-ce votre maison éternelle ? Ou simplement camping ?<page>Les pèlerins n'ont pas de maison, ils ont un chemin. Nous grimpons, nous souffrons et nous sommes jugés.<page>Pour le commerce, je ne suis ici que pour un moment. Lorsque vous prenez assez du Rosaire, vous devenez suffisamment saint pour vous lever sans crainte.

original_en_text: <hpage>On the far side of Pharloom, I chanced upon a bug starkly similar to yourself.<hpage>From her home, her dress, and her skill, I am guessing you share some relation?<page>Aye. Met my sister, you did, in order at least. Glad to hear she’s still among the living.<page>Last to hold true to the old ways of the pin, she was... I sure ain’t sharing many of those violent values no more.<page>I’ll warn you, stray one, my sister might seem all cheer and charm, but buried beneath there’s the soul of a killer.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我在纺络另一端遇见过与你极为相似的虫。<hpage>根据其居所、衣着和技艺，也许是你血亲？<page>是，那是我的姐妹。她还活着呢？也挺好。<page>她是最后恪守古训的针匠……我早就不玩那套杀戮把戏了。<page>提醒你，我那姐妹看着亲切，骨子里可是杀胚。
translated_text: <hpage>On the other side of the pharam, I came across a worm that looked just like you.<hpage>Judging by her house, her clothes, her skills, what do you think you have to do with it?<page>Yes, you have seen my sister, at least in order. Glad to hear that she is alive.<page>She's the last person to stick to the old pin way. I will never share violent values again. "<page>I warn you, vagabond, my sister may seem happy and attractive, but within her lies the soul of a murderer.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>De l'autre côté du pharam, je suis tombé sur un ver qui ressemblait à vous.<hpage>À en juger par sa maison, ses vêtements, ses compétences, qu ' est-ce que vous pensez avoir à voir avec cela ?<page>Oui, vous avez vu ma sœur, du moins dans l'ordre. Je suis content d'apprendre qu 'elle est vivante.<page>Elle est la dernière personne à s'en tenir à la vieille façon d'épingle. Je ne partagerai plus jamais de valeurs violentes. "<page>Je te préviens, vagabond, ma sœur peut sembler joyeuse et séduisante, mais en elle se trouve l'âme d'un meurtrier.

original_en_text: You would deny my brood their strength, ssspiidderr? A cruel creature you are. Surely your sssmall shell needs hardly so much?
original_zh_text: 你准备饿着我的孩子吗，小蜘蛛？咝——心肠够硬啊。不过，你这小身板能独吞这么多？
translated_text: Are you going to deny my children the power? You are a cruel creature. Isn't SSsmall shell so necessary?
secondary_translated_text: Va-t - il refuser à mes enfants le pouvoir ? Tu es une créature cruelle. N'est-ce pas que le SSsmall shell est nécessaire ?

original_en_text: I’ll string your rosaries tight, for a modest fee. It’s the safest way to keep them close.
original_zh_text: 分我一些念珠，我帮你把它们串牢。贴身保管最稳妥。
translated_text: I will tie your rosary tightly. It is the safest way to get them.
secondary_translated_text: Je vais attacher votre chapelet fermement. C'est le moyen le plus sûr de les obtenir.

original_en_text: Uoohhh... Sister, my aching shell’s close to breaking. My voice weakens... I can hardly sing a word.<hpage>I fear the path ahead will be no easier for you, ma’am. If you can not abandon your pilgrimage, you should at least rest well before continuing.<page>Ahh... but impurities stalk our every step, sister. If we rest too long, they shall catch us. So... so it is sung...
original_zh_text: 啊……姐妹，我的甲壳快撑不住了……嗓子也哑……唱不动圣歌了……<hpage>前路只会更加凶险，女士。若不愿放弃朝圣，至少养足精神再走。<page>唉……可邪秽如影随形，歇久了必被追上……圣训……是这么唱的……
translated_text: ah... Sister, my pain shell is about to burst. Her voice weakened. I could hardly sing a word.<hpage>Unfortunately the road ahead is not easy, if you can not give up the pilgrimage, you should at least take a break.<page>ah... Be with us every step of the way, sister. If you rest for too long, you will get caught. So... I sang it.
secondary_translated_text: Ah, oui. Sœur, ma coquille de douleur est sur le point d'éclater. Sa voix s'affaiblit. Je pouvais à peine chanter un mot.<hpage>Malheureusement, la route à suivre n'est pas facile, si vous ne pouvez pas abandonner le pèlerinage, vous devriez au moins faire une pause.<page>Ah, oui. Sois avec nous à chaque étape du chemin, soeur. Si vous vous reposez trop longtemps, vous allez être attrapé. Donc... Je l'ai chanté.

original_en_text: That golden knight’s out there, sister, cutting down the lost, keeping us safe.<page>Reckon this place would’ve already been overrun if not for them’n their noble blades.
original_zh_text: 小姐，那位金甲骑士在外面斩杀着被诅咒者，保护我们的安全。<page>没有他那伟大的刺刃，这地方早就败落了。
translated_text: Sister, the Golden Knight is there to destroy the lost and protect us. "<page>If it weren't for the blade, this place would have been occupied long ago.
secondary_translated_text: Sœur, le Chevalier d'Or est là pour détruire les perdus et nous protéger. "<page>Si ce n'était pas pour la lame, cet endroit aurait été occupé il y a longtemps.

original_en_text: Take some beads for your effort, miss bellringer, and know this sad lot’ll be survivin’ a little longer thanks to you.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者小姐，拿些念珠当作辛苦费吧。多亏你，这些可怜虫又能多苟活几天了。
translated_text: Miss Bellinger, prepare beads for your efforts. " Thanks to you, this sad fate will last for a while.
secondary_translated_text: Mlle Bellinger, prépare des perles pour vos efforts.« Grâce à vous, ce triste destin durera encore un moment.

original_en_text: S’done! The parts are prepared. I’m headin’ up now to set the heavy thing.<page>Even with the trap laid, best be guessin’ her on top won’t go down so simple. She’ll sense what’s comin’.<page>That blade of yours is gonna have to do its work ‘fore this thing can snap.<hpage>I’d expected such, sir. And I am ready. Set your snare. I shall attend shortly.
original_zh_text: 搞定了！部件准备完毕。我这就上去布置。<page>就算陷阱就位，顶上那位也不会乖乖受死。她能预感到潜在的危机。<page>你得先用你的针刃削弱她，这玩意才能触发。<hpage>我早有预料，先生。我已准备就绪。布置陷阱吧，我随后就到。
translated_text: it's over! Parts are ready. I'm going to gain weight from now on.<page>Even if a trap is set up, it's best to assume she won't fall easily out of it. She feels that she should come.<page>Before it breaks, your blade has to work.<hpage>I was expecting I was ready to set a trap for you. I'll be joining soon.
secondary_translated_text: C'est fini ! Les pièces sont prêtes. Je vais prendre du poids à partir de maintenant<page>Même si un piège est mis en place, il est préférable de supposer qu ' elle ne va pas tomber facilement en dehors.<page>Avant qu 'il ne se casse, votre lame doit fonctionner.<hpage>Je pensais que j'étais prêt à te préparer un piège. Je vais me joindre bientôt.

original_en_text: Everything is falling apart, my dear one. Be sure to share your rosaries with me before it’s too late!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，这里的一切都在分崩离析。趁现在还来得及，把你的念珠分我一些吧！
translated_text: Everything's broken, darling. Please share your rosary with me before it's too late!
secondary_translated_text: Tout est cassé, chéri. S'il vous plaît partagez votre chapelet avec moi avant qu ' il ne soit trop tard !

original_en_text: Lots of stories being sung about you, dear one. Gathering supplies, saving lost bugs... all sorts of good deeds!<page>Very clever to craft such a reputation for yourself. If you keep it up, you’ll fast become a legend among these simple sorts.<hpage>I’ve no interest in becoming one, madam. In my long life, I’ve known enough legends, watched them rise and fall and fade away, many times.<page>Is that so, dear? How humble you are! You should know though, this old pilgrim has her sight keenly trained on you! Nothing gets by old Jubilana!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，现在好多虫子都在传颂你的事迹呢。收集物资、拯救迷失的虫子……全是各种各样的善举！<page>你很聪明，给自己打造了这么好的名声。这样下去，你很快就会成为这些单纯的家伙们心中的传奇啦。<hpage>女士，我可没兴趣成为什么传奇。在漫长的一生中，我见识过足够多的传奇，无数次看着他们崛起、衰落、消逝。<page>这样啊？亲爱的，你可真谦逊！不过你要知道，我这个老朝圣者可一直密切关注着你呢！什么都逃不过老朱比拉娜的眼睛！
translated_text: You have a lot of stories. Collect supplies and rescue lost insects. All sorts of good deeds!<page>It's wise to build that reputation yourself. If you keep on doing that, you'll soon become a legend of these simple characters.<hpage>I'm not interested in that, lady. In my long life, I have studied the legend well enough, and witnessed its rise and fall many times.<page>Is that right, honey? How humble that is! But know that the eyes of this pilgrim are looking at you with ease. The old Jubilee is doing nothing!
secondary_translated_text: Vous avez beaucoup d'histoires. Collectez des fournitures et sauvez les insectes perdus. Toutes sortes de bonnes œuvres !<page>Il est sage de construire cette réputation vous-même. Si vous continuez à faire cela, vous deviendrez bientôt une légende de ces personnages simples.<hpage>Je ne m'intéresse pas à ça, madame. Au cours de ma longue vie, j'ai assez bien étudié la légende et j'ai été témoin de sa montée et de sa chute à maintes reprises.<page>N'est-ce pas vrai, ma chérie ? Comme c'est humble ! Mais sachez que les yeux de ce pèlerin vous regardent avec aisance. L'ancien Jubilé ne fait rien !

original_en_text: It was you, wasn’t it? Ringin’ that great clanging bell just now! Right when I’m tryin’ to get some sleep!
original_zh_text: 刚才敲钟的是你吧？叮呤咣啷的！我正要补觉呢！
translated_text: you are, aren't you? There was a huge sound! When you are trying to sleep!
secondary_translated_text: Vous l'êtes, n'est-ce pas ? Il y avait un énorme son ! Quand tu essaies de dormir !

original_en_text: Please don’t go too far, sister. Right here’s the only safety you’ll find within this whole cursed place.
original_zh_text: 小姐，千万别走远。在这片诅咒之地，这儿是唯一安全的地方。
translated_text: Sister, please don't go far. This is the only safe place you'll find in this cursed place.
secondary_translated_text: S'il vous plaît, ne vous éloignez pas. C'est le seul endroit sûr que vous trouverez dans cet endroit maudit.

original_en_text: There must be a few more goodies to gather up here, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: There is certainly a good thing to collect here, and this time you don't need to walk around. Blessings, goodbye!
secondary_translated_text: Il y a certainement une bonne chose à collecter ici, et cette fois, vous n'avez pas besoin de vous promener. Bénédictions, au revoir !

original_en_text: Well, well! See here what your brash behaviour has wrought, bellringer!<page>Just as I predicted, this once-peaceful sanctuary is now crawling with all sorts. We’ve the beginnings of a shabby little settlement, all huddled around this old shrine!<hpage>These poor bugs, all are victims of the Citadel and its insidious attraction. This place draws them up, into its maw, only to consume them, utterly.<page>Aye, inside and out, s’nothing but a grand, gilded lie. Well, at least these few stragglers can enjoy a moment’s safety. Poor fools...
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧你干的好事，敲钟者！<page>跟我料想的一样，这座本来平静的钟殿现在挤满了各色杂碎！一帮可怜虫围着那旧钟搭了个窝！<hpage>这些可怜虫都是圣堡的牺牲品，被它的谎话骗来，最终将被吞噬殆尽。<page>哼哼，这里就是个外表光鲜的巨大骗局。不过至少这群蠢货能享受片刻安宁……
translated_text: yeah. yeah. Look at what your arrogance has caused, Berlinger!<page>As expected, this once quiet refuge is now full of people of all kinds. We have built a small, austere settlement that packs everything around this ancient temple!<hpage>These poor insects were victims of the castle and its cunning charm. This place will only attract them, put them in the stomach and consume them completely.<page>Yes, from the inside out, it's just a grand, golden lie. At the very least, the people left behind can enjoy a safe moment. Poor fool. "
secondary_translated_text: Oui, oui. Oui, oui. Regardez ce que votre arrogance a causé, Berlinger !<page>Comme prévu, ce refuge autrefois calme est maintenant rempli de personnes de toutes sortes. Nous avons construit une petite colonie austère qui rassemble tout autour de cet ancien temple !<hpage>Ces pauvres insectes furent victimes du château et de son charme sournois. Cet endroit ne fera que les attirer, les mettre dans l'estomac et les consommer complètement.<page>Oui, de l'intérieur, c'est juste un grand mensonge d'or. Au moins, les personnes laissées pour compte peuvent profiter d'un moment sûr. Pauvre imbécile. "

original_en_text: A precious order passed down by the holy conductors. Rare now to find these old texts, and rarer still to find a bug able to read ‘em.
original_zh_text: 神圣指挥官亲笔签发的珍稀敕令。如今，这种古卷已经很难找到了，而能读懂它们的虫子就更少见了。
translated_text: The Sacred Commander. It's hard to find these old texts, and even harder to find errors that can read them.
secondary_translated_text: Le commandant sacré. Il est difficile de trouver ces vieux textes, et encore plus difficile de trouver des erreurs qui peuvent les lire.

original_en_text: Ooh, what a turn-up! I’d feared t’was naught but meself left sane about these halls. Seems this old bug’s luck has not yet worn thin!<hpage>It was more than luck that saw me to you, madam. I promised the wish of bugs concerned for your safety.<hpage>I urge you to head their way now, beside the old bell, up and over.<hpage>A small settlement has formed there, and the bell, reawakened, seems to ward away the worst of the Citadel’s many dangers.<page>A settlement? In these long-haunted halls? Are you telling naughty little lies, dear one? Well, I suppose there’s not too much danger in going and seeing the truth for meself.
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！还以为这鬼地方只剩我没发疯呢！看来我这只老婆子运气还没用完！<hpage>我能找到你可不只是运气使然，女士，我是受其他虫子所托来确保你的安全。请尽快前往上方那座古钟，同那些虫子会合。<hpage>那古钟周围形成了一个小型庇护所，重鸣的钟声似乎能驱散圣堡的大部分危险。<page>庇护所？在这闹鬼的圣堡？亲爱的，你在编故事吧？不过亲眼去看看也无妨~
translated_text: Oh, that's great! I thought it was okay, but I focused on this hall. Apparently, this old bug's luck is not running out!<hpage>I am not lucky to meet you. I agree with the wishes of bugs that care about your safety.<hpage>I suggest you go in their direction right now, go by the old bell, and go up again.<hpage>A small settlement was formed there, and the bells were again summoned, and it seemed that they could protect the worst of the castle's many dangers.<page>reconciliation? in this long haunted mansion? Honey, are you lying a naughty lie? I don't think it's dangerous to look at the truth.
secondary_translated_text: Oh, c'est génial ! Je pensais que ça allait bien, mais je me suis concentré sur cette salle. Apparemment, la chance de ce vieux bug ne s'épuise pas !<hpage>Je n'ai pas la chance de vous rencontrer. Je suis d'accord avec les souhaits des bugs qui se soucient de votre sécurité.<hpage>Je vous suggère d'aller dans leur direction maintenant, de passer par la vieille cloche, et de remonter.<hpage>Une petite colonie s'y forma, et les cloches furent de nouveau invoquées, et il semblait qu ' elles pouvaient protéger le pire des nombreux dangers du château.<page>Réconciliation ? Dans ce long manoir hanté ? Chérie, tu mens un mensonge méchant ? Je ne pense pas qu ' il soit dangereux de regarder la vérité.

original_en_text: Be away then, dear one, and leave me to gather up my trinkets and baubles.<page>If this settlement of yours truly has bugs settled safe, I’ll be able to make some lucrative trades. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 快走吧，亲爱的。别耽误我收拾我的宝贝货物。<page>要是你那庇护所真能安生做生意，老婆子我定能大赚一笔！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: Come on, honey, come on, let me clean up my little things.<page>If your settlement resolves the mistake safely, I can make some profitable deals. Blessings and farewell!
secondary_translated_text: Allez, chérie, viens, laisse-moi nettoyer mes petites affaires.<page>Si votre règlement résout l'erreur en toute sécurité, je peux faire des affaires rentables. Bénédictions et au revoir !

original_en_text: It’s feelin’ almost time, eh, bellringer? You and her who waits up there. That fated meeting won’t hold forever... Ready to make your play, to oust one ruler and claim her place?<hpage>I’ll not deny some part of me desires that outcome... Dominance, it seems, is baked deep in my blood, as too, no doubt, for the one up top.<hpage>And yet, another part resists... A part, over time, I find myself siding with more...<hpage>That part wishes not to claim a monarch’s mantle, rather it would see my freedom regained, and this kingdom’s bugs unshackled from their pale chains.<page>...Remarkable idea you’re speakin’ there, bellringer, a world cut free. Not a wish I’ve had much cause to hope on, serious like... but I ain’t so surprised to hear you speak it.<page>For all your helpin’, I been seein’ it clearer. You’ve still got the monarch in you, alright, and the glare of a Weaver, but the ambition... that’s wild different from both.<hpage>If you have already guessed to my desire, sir, and share some part of it, would you offer me aid in the conflict to come?<page>Aye... Maybe, yes. I can barely bear to tell it... But there’s an idea, one rare discussed, for fear of her up there sensin’ the score.<hpage>You have conceived a method, I take it? A way to see a monarch... removed? And me left free from claiming her station?<page>...We have, me and what remains of my family. S’a trap, of a sort, beyond the skill of this Citadel, one to go further than just her binding. You’d be just the hunter to set it, if you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 时机快到了吧，敲钟者？你和顶上那位迟早要碰面……准备好推翻旧主，自己上位了吗？<hpage>一定程度上，我不否认自己渴求这样的结果……我的统治欲深植血脉，和顶上那位一样。<hpage>但另一部分的我在抗拒……而这一部分正变得愈发强烈……<hpage>不想戴上王冠，只盼重获自由，让这王国的虫民挣脱苍白的枷锁。<page>一个解脱束缚的世界……真是难以想象。我虽然不敢奢望，但从你嘴里说出来倒不意外。<page>看你四处救援，我也明白了。你确有君王的血统和织者的锋芒，但野心……和两者都截然不同。<hpage>先生，既然你已了解我的想法，可否在即将到来的纷乱中助我一臂之力？<page>啊……或许可以吧。我有一计……但这是一招险棋，鲜少被提及，唯恐被顶上那位察觉。<hpage>也就是说……你有能让我弑君并自由脱身的方法？<page>我们……我那残存的家族确实有个计划。那是一种陷阱，一种超越圣堡的陷阱。而你恰好能成为安放这个陷阱的猎手——如果你胆子够大的话……
translated_text: I feel like the time is approaching. You and she are waiting there. A fateful encounter doesn't last forever - - are you ready to begin a plan to take down the ruler and take her throne?<hpage>I can't deny that a part of me wants a result. Dominance seems to be deeply rooted in my blood, and I have no doubt about dominating at the top.<hpage>But others resisted. " As time went on, I was on more side.<hpage>They don't want the monarch's cloak, but they want to see me set free and the insects of the kingdom set free from their pale chains.<page>... What you're talking about there, Belinger, is a wonderful idea of a free world. I don't have much reason to want it, but I seriously like it. But I wouldn't be surprised if they told me so.<page>Thank you for helping me, I can see clearly. You still have the temperament of a monarch, well, a talent for weaving, but ambition. This is completely different from both.<hpage>If you could guess my wishes and share some of them, would you help me in the conflict to come? "<page>Yes, maybe, yes. I don't have the courage to say that. But there are ideas that are rarely discussed for fear that she will feel the score.<hpage>I think you have understood how to meet the monarch. delete it? did i not replace her?<page>... Just me and my family. It was a trap of some sort, beyond the capacity of this castle, and far beyond her chains. If you have the courage to take the challenge, you are the hunter who sets it.
secondary_translated_text: J'ai l'impression que le temps approche. Vous et elle vous attendent là. Une rencontre fatidique ne dure pas éternellement - êtes-vous prêt à commencer un plan pour renverser le souverain et prendre son trône ?<hpage>Je ne peux pas nier qu 'une partie de moi veut un résultat. La domination semble être profondément enracinée dans mon sang, et je n'ai aucun doute sur la domination au sommet.<hpage>Mais d'autres résistaient.« Au fur et à mesure que le temps passait, j'étais de plus en plus de côté.<hpage>Ils ne veulent pas le manteau du monarque, mais ils veulent me voir libéré et les insectes du royaume libérés de leurs chaînes pâles.<page>... Ce dont vous parlez, Belinger, c'est une merveilleuse idée d'un monde libre. Je n'ai pas beaucoup de raisons de le vouloir, mais je l'aime sérieusement. Mais je ne serais pas surpris s'ils me le disaient.<page>Merci de m'avoir aidé, je vois bien. Vous avez encore le tempérament d'un monarque, eh bien, un talent pour le tissage, mais l'ambition. C'est complètement différent des deux.<hpage>Si vous pouviez deviner mes souhaits et en partager quelques-uns, m'aideriez-vous dans le conflit à venir ? "<page>Oui, peut - être, oui. Je n'ai pas le courage de dire ça. Mais il y a des idées qui sont rarement discutées de peur qu ' elle ne ressente la partition.<hpage>Je crois que vous avez compris comment rencontrer le monarque. Supprimer ? Je ne l'ai pas remplacé ?<page>... Juste moi et ma famille. C'était une sorte de piège, au-delà de la capacité de ce château, et bien au-delà de ses chaînes. Si vous avez le courage de relever le défi, vous êtes le chasseur qui le pose.

original_en_text: What’s that you got there, bellringer? Stole someone else’s soul for yourself?<hpage>You speak of the remnant I found in the muck-choked caves beside the Citadel? This is soul siphoned from a once powerful bug.<hpage>It’s only a thin mix now, but there is still some strength left. At peak, their talents must have been impressive.<page>Aye, they was that. I knew the bug, in ‘is prime, long time back. Braver’n most, and as little a fan of this Citadel as you yourself.<page>Went seekin’ alliance with those basic bugs of the swamps. Thought they’d both gain from the union... Scheming defiance, or some such stupidity!<page>Now he’s as dead as he was daft! Don’t go tryin’ ta make friends in Pharloom, bellringer. Nothin’ good comes of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你手里攥着什么？偷了谁的灵魂？<hpage>你是说我在圣堡旁边泥沼洞穴里找到的灵魂？这是从一只强大的甲虫身上剥离出来的。<hpage>虽然稀薄但尚存力量，全盛时期定非等闲之辈。<page>啊，没错！我认识那虫子，当年也算条好汉，而且跟你一样厌恶圣堡。<page>居然想联合沼泽平民搞叛乱！以为能互利共赢……真是蠢到家的反抗计划！<page>现在死得渣都不剩！所以说，在纺络交朋友准没好下场！
translated_text: what do you have, the bell ringing? stealing someone else's soul for yourself?<hpage>you mean the remains found in the muddy cave next to the castle? a soul drawn from a once mighty insect.<hpage>It is a weak combination now, but it still has a certain strength. Their talents would have been impressive at their peak.<page>Oh, yeah. I think this mistake was a golden age long ago. The bravest man does not love the castle as much as you.<page>Alliances with these basic bacteria are found in wetlands and they all benefit from alliances. Conspiracy and provocation, or anything like that!<page>He died as stupidly as ever! " Don't try to make friends in the Faro, Bel Linger. There are no good results.
secondary_translated_text: Qu ' est-ce que tu as, la cloche qui sonne ? Voler l'âme d'autrui pour vous-même ?<hpage>Vous voulez dire les restes trouvés dans la grotte boueuse à côté du château ? Une âme tirée d'un insecte autrefois puissant.<hpage>C'est une combinaison faible maintenant, mais elle a toujours une certaine force. Leur talent aurait été impressionnant à son apogée.<page>- Oh, oui. Je pense que cette erreur était un âge d'or il y a longtemps. L'homme le plus courageux n'aime pas le château autant que vous.<page>Les alliances avec ces bactéries de base se trouvent dans les zones humides et elles bénéficient toutes des alliances. Conspiration et provocation, ou quelque chose du genre !<page>Il est mort aussi stupide que jamais.« N'essayez pas de vous faire des amis dans le Faro, Bel Linger. Il n'y a pas de bons résultats.

original_en_text: Hmph. Bellringer, you might think me a dullard, but I understand this place and have well-good senses.<page>Brought here, weren’t you? From beyond the border of our lands?<hpage>You are correct. The one who waits atop this Citadel... Through their hospitality, I arrived in this kingdom. I seek now to return that welcome in kind.<page>Hmph. Beastly words, them. Finely spoken, but beastly all the same.<page>I just pray you don’t bring any more unneeded pain down on the heads of these gormless little pilgrims...
original_zh_text: 哼，敲钟者，别当我是蠢货。我对这地方算是知根知底，而且我的预感往往很灵验。<page>你是从纺络境外被“请”来的吧？<hpage>没错。圣堡顶端那位邀请我来到这个王国……盛情难却，现在轮到我回礼了。<page>冠冕堂皇的野兽做派！话说得再漂亮，骨子里还是透出兽性！<page>只希望你别再牵连这些呆头呆脑的朝圣者……
translated_text: Hey, Berlinger, you may think I'm an idiot, but I know this place, and I have a great sense of it.<page>you brought me here, didn't you? Outside the boundaries of our land?<hpage>You are right about the people waiting on the top of the castle. By their hospitality, I have come into the kingdom. Now, I'm returning that welcome in the same way.<page>You speak like a beast. He spoke very well, but he was still barbaric.<page>I am praying that these foolish pilgrims will not suffer any more unnecessary suffering.
secondary_translated_text: Hé, Berlinger, vous pouvez penser que je suis un idiot, mais je connais cet endroit, et j'en ai un bon sens.<page>Tu m'as amené ici, n'es-ce pas ? En dehors des frontières de notre pays ?<hpage>Vous avez raison sur les gens qui attendent au sommet du château. C'est par leur hospitalité que je suis entré dans le royaume. Je vous accueille de la même manière.<page>Tu parles comme une bête. Il parlait très bien, mais il était encore barbare.<page>Je prie pour que ces pèlerins insensés ne souffrent plus inutilement.

original_en_text: Found it all, did ya, bellringer? Then join me and let’s get to preppin’! I’ll be askin’ both your Silk and your claws ‘fore the construction.
original_zh_text: 找齐了是吧？那就快来搭把手！我需要你的灵丝和利爪参与构建。
translated_text: you found it all, right? belllinger? Let's start preparing with me! We will ask you about silk and nails before construction.
secondary_translated_text: Tu as tout trouvé, n'est pas ? Bellinger ? Commençons à vous préparer avec moi ! Nous vous demanderons de la soie et des ongles avant la construction.

original_en_text: The Citadel chose us, granted us a little more living. For what purpose though, who could say?
original_zh_text: 圣堡选择了我们，赏我们多活两天。谁知道是出于什么目的呢？
translated_text: The castle chose us and gave us more life. But who can explain its purpose?
secondary_translated_text: Le château nous a choisis et nous a donnés plus de vie. Qui peut expliquer son but ?

original_en_text: If’n your wantin’ that trap made, you’d best get to collectin’. I’ll point you toward what’s needed, best as I can.
original_zh_text: 如果决定要把那个陷阱造出来，就快去收集所需的部分。我会告诉你需要做什么。
translated_text: If you want that trap, you better collect it. I will do my best to tell you what you want.
secondary_translated_text: Si vous voulez ce piège, vous feriez mieux de le ramasser. je ferai de mon mieux pour vous dire ce que vous voulez.

original_en_text: Heard you did the savin’ for our dear merchant there? I’ve seen her about, sneaking and scrounging, even a’fore you was ringing that bell.<page>She’s a useful sort, but don’t let her age be foolin’, she’s still the sharpest mind for a deal.<page>Won’t be long till there’s nary a rosary about this shrine that ain’t found its way into her pockets.
original_zh_text: 听说你救了那个奸商？早在你敲钟之前，我就瞧见她在这儿鬼鬼祟祟扒拉破烂了。<page>别看她老，坑钱手段多着呢！<page>要不了多久，这附近的念珠全得进她腰包！
translated_text: I heard you saved our dear businessman's money. Before he could ring the doorbell, he saw her begging.<page>She's a useful person, but don't make her stupid even though she's old. She's still the smartest person around.<page>After a while, a rosary from the temple came into her pocket.
secondary_translated_text: J'ai entendu que vous avez sauvé l'argent de notre cher homme d'affaires. Avant qu 'il ne puisse sonner à la porte, il la vit mendier.<page>Elle est une personne utile, mais ne la rend pas stupide même si elle est vieille. Elle est toujours la personne la plus intelligente autour.<page>Après un certain temps, un chapelet du temple est venu dans sa poche.

original_en_text: Bellringer... Re-thinkin’ on that trap, are ya? It’s a mad method, for sure, but you’d be just the hunter to set it, if’n you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者……有重新考虑过陷阱的事吗？这想法虽然疯狂，但对你来说最合适不过了……如果你胆子够大的话。
translated_text: The one who rings the bell. Are you rethinking the trap? Of course, it's a crazy approach, but if you dare to try it, you're just a hunter setting it up.
secondary_translated_text: Celui qui sonne la cloche. Vous repenserez le piège ? Bien sûr, c'est une approche folle, mais si vous osez l'essayer, vous n'êtes qu ' un chasseur fou qui l'installe.

original_en_text: <hpage>Grant me your aid, sir. If your trap provides a path to freedom, both for myself and your land’s bugs, I may indeed choose to trigger it.<hpage>What work do you require of me now to see your service made?<page>It’s my family’s strength you’ll need be seeking, bellringer, us three ol’ bugs still alive, spread ‘cross this kingdom, and one poor cousin dead and drained in swamps choked rotten.<page>Each has power. Raw, savage stuff! For you, they’ll give it, if for their fascination at the act, or the thrill of defiance... or because they have no choice at all.
original_zh_text: <hpage>请助我一臂之力，先生。若你的陷阱真能为这片土地的虫子和我带来自由，我愿成为那个安放它的猎手。<hpage>现在需要我做些什么？<page>去召集我家族的力量——三个苟活的老家伙，他们分散王国各处。还有个可怜的表弟，他死在了腐臭的沼泽。<page>我的家人每个都带着野蛮原始的力量！他们会把力量交给你——或是出于对你这种勇气的欣赏，或是享受反抗带来的的亢奋……抑或是别无选择。
translated_text: <hpage>Please help me sir. If your trap offers me and the worms of your land a way to freedom, I may choose to cause it. "<hpage>What would you like to do now to see your service?<page>Bel Linger I need to find the strength of my family There are still three "worms" alive in our kingdom, and a poor cousin who has suffocated in the swamp.<page>Everyone has power. " Barbaric, barbaric things! For you, it's because if they get into acting or have a rebellious excitement, they'll either give you or have no choice at all.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>S'il vous plaît, aidez-moi monsieur. Si votre piège me donne, à moi et aux vers de votre terre, un chemin vers la liberté, je choisirais de le provoquer. »<hpage>Que souhaitez-vous faire maintenant pour voir votre service ?<page>Il y a encore trois « vers » vivants dans notre royaume, et un pauvre cousin qui s'est étouffé dans le marais.<page>Tout le monde a le pouvoir.« Des choses barbares, barbares ! Pour vous, c'est parce que s'ils entrent dans l'acteur ou ont une excitation rebelle, ils vous donneront ou n'auront pas le choix du tout.

original_en_text: Real fine key this. No doubt it’ll open the way to somewhere special. Somewhere full of goodies, I’ll bet. Find the lock, and it’ll practically pay for itself!
original_zh_text: 上等货色！毫无疑问，它准能打开某个特殊地方的通路。我敢打赌，那地方肯定堆满了好东西。找到对应的锁，这钥匙就物超所值啦！
translated_text: This is a very good key. It will undoubtedly pave the way to a special place. I think it's a place full of good things. Once you find the lock, you can effectively be self-supported!
secondary_translated_text: C'est une très bonne clé. Il ouvrira sans aucun doute la voie à un endroit spécial. Je pense que c'est un endroit plein de bonnes choses. Une fois que vous avez trouvé la serrure, vous pouvez effectivement être autonome !

original_en_text: <hpage>Caretaker, I bring supplies from the town of bells below the Citadel.<page>And badly needed they are, miss bellringer. Ain’t much finding or foraging happening with this mob, what with them choir types all stalkin’ about the chambers beside.
original_zh_text: <hpage>看守者先生，我从圣堡下方的钟心镇带了补给。<page>啊！真是雪中送炭！圣咏团在附近晃悠，这帮怂包根本不敢出去觅食。
translated_text: <hpage>i brought supplies from the town of bell beneath butler castle.<page>Mr. Bellinger's mob desperately needed them, but their choir was prowling around a room nearby, and they were all in the same place.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>J'ai apporté des fournitures de la ville de Bell sous le château de Butler.<page>La foule de M. Bellinger avait désespérément besoin d'eux, mais leur chorale flottait dans une pièce voisine, et ils étaient tous au même endroit.

original_en_text: Buried in the warren of bells, at Pharloom’s core, seek my sullen uncle. That one has power to spare.
original_zh_text: 去纺络的核心地带，在到处是钟的地方找我那阴沉的叔叔，他的力量多得没处使。
translated_text: The man has extra power when he searches for his dark uncle buried in a bell in the center of the farm.
secondary_translated_text: L'homme a un pouvoir supplémentaire lorsqu 'il recherche son oncle sombre enterré dans une cloche au centre de la ferme.

original_en_text: So you found this place too, sister? This Citadel’s grand promise has been strangled away by cursed thread, but at least the great bell here grants us some sanctuary.<page>We’re amongst the blessed few... granted just a little more living.
original_zh_text: 小姐，你也找到这个地方了啊？我们可真是走运。圣堡曾经的宏伟都因丝咒化为了泡影，但多亏了那座大钟，我们才能安全地待在这儿。<page>也许只是片刻安宁，但能多活一会儿……但在这病怏怏的鬼地方，多活片刻就是最好的福报了。
translated_text: Did you find this place, sister? The magnificent views of the castle are suffocated by a curse thread, but at least the huge clock here gives us some shelter.<page>We are a minority, a little bit of life.
secondary_translated_text: As-tu trouvé cet endroit, ma soeur ? Les magnifiques vues sur le château sont étouffées par un fil de malédiction, mais au moins l'énorme horloge ici nous donne un abri.<page>Nous sommes une minorité, un peu de vie.

original_en_text: Off you go now, dear one. If it’s my trinkets you covet, you can trade me your rosaries up at the shrine. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 你该走了，亲爱的。如果你想要我的这些宝贝，就来钟殿用念珠跟我换！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: Darling, I can go now. If you want my little one, please bring your rosary to the shrine. Blessings and farewell!
secondary_translated_text: - Chérie, je peux partir maintenant. Si vous voulez mon petit, apportez votre chapelet au sanctuaire. Bénédictions et au revoir !

original_en_text: Ooohh... If we’re no longer pilgrims... What are we?
original_zh_text: 噢……我们如果不再是朝圣者了……那会成为什么呢？
translated_text: Oh, what are we, if we cease to be pilgrims? "
secondary_translated_text: Oh, que serons-nous, si nous cessons d'être des pèlerins ? "

original_en_text: Crafty types used to go all a’clamour for this metal. S’not much to look at, but I still remember its value.
original_zh_text: 当年被工匠们抢破头的金属材料。看着不起眼，但老婆子我记得它可金贵着呢。
translated_text: Crafty people once admired this metal. I don't see anything, but I remember its value.
secondary_translated_text: Les gens crainants admiraient jadis ce métal. Je ne vois rien, mais je me souviens de sa valeur.

translated_text: Hey! I'm here!
secondary_translated_text: Hey ! Je suis ici !

original_en_text: This shrine, awakened... it calls out to ‘em, you see. “It’s safe here. Come on over!” ringing in the ears of every lost pilgrim and grubby so-and-so unlucky enough to have made it to this blasted Citadel with their wits intact.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! I ain’t dealing with all the fresh intake myself!<hpage>If time permits, sir bug, I shall visit again.
original_zh_text: 只要这钟殿醒着，那些迷途的朝圣者和肮脏的食腐者就会收到召唤。<page>就像在那些家伙耳边低语“这里安全，快来！”，然后他们就会屁颠屁颠地涌向这座被诅咒的城堡。<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙！我可不想独自应付这些新来的蠢货！<hpage>先生，若有空闲，我会再来。
translated_text: This temple has already awakened it is calling them, look. "This is safe. come here! "The lost pilgrims and the filthy unhappy all resounded in their ears, and their wisdom reached the castle unblemished and abandoned."<page>What you did, what you did, what you did. Come back quickly, you idiot! You can't eat fresh food on your own!<hpage>If time permits, Mr. Bug, I will visit again.
secondary_translated_text: Ce temple s'est déjà réveillé, il les appelle, regardez ! "C'est sûr. Venez ici. Les pèlerins perdus et les malheureux souillés résonnaient tous dans leurs oreilles, et leur sagesse atteignait le château immaculé et abandonné. "<page>Ce que vous avez fait, ce que vous avez fait, ce que vous avez fait. Reviens vite, espèce d'idiot ! Vous ne pouvez pas manger des aliments frais par vous-même !<hpage>Si le temps le permet, monsieur Bug, je reviendrai.

original_en_text: Guess I shouldn’t be surprised. It’s a fool act to try such a thing... Maybe even to think on it. Your kind ain’t designed to die.
original_zh_text: 果然还是有所顾虑吗？企图弑君本就是蠢行……或许连想都不该想。你们这一族的命数本就不包括死亡。
translated_text: I don't think that's surprising. You might even think it would be stupid to try this. People like you are not designed to die.
secondary_translated_text: Je ne pense pas que cela soit surprenant. Vous pourriez même penser qu 'il serait stupide d'essayer cela. Les gens comme toi ne sont pas faits pour mourir.

original_en_text: For the last part, I’ll also be needin’ that rune setter you’re carryin’. Clever old Weaver tool, that thing, and the perfect base on which to stretch our power.<page>Once you’ve collected for yourself the other critical parts, I’ll ask you pass it over as well.
original_zh_text: 最后还需要你身上那个陷阱设置器。精巧的织者工具，正好可以用来作为我们陷阱的基底。<page>等你集齐了其他部分，就把这玩意也交给我。
translated_text: In the last part, you also need to "set up the runes you take with you." A clever old-fashioned weaver tool, it, and the perfect foundation to extend our power.<page>Once you've collected the other important components for yourself, I'll ask you to pass them on.
secondary_translated_text: Dans la dernière partie, vous devez également « mettre en place les runes que vous emportez avec vous.« Un outil de tisserie vieux et intelligent, et la base parfaite pour étendre notre pouvoir.<page>Une fois que vous aurez rassemblé les autres composants importants pour vous-même, je vous demanderai de les transmettre.

original_en_text: Find the husk of my cousin, claimed by the scorned bugs of the swamps. A careless fool to let himself be taken, and dead they might be, but some glimmer of his soul can still be sensed.
original_zh_text: 找到我表弟的躯壳，它被沼泽中满怀怨愤的虫子占据了。他粗心大意，才会被抓住并害死。但我仍能感受到他灵魂散发的的一丝微光。
translated_text: When I find my cousin's shell, it will be occupied by the contemptuous insects of the swamp. The careless fool, deprived of himself, and they may be dead, but you can still feel the light in his soul.
secondary_translated_text: Quand je trouverai la coquille de mon cousin, elle sera occupée par les insectes méprisants du marais. L'insouciant, privé de lui-même, et ils peuvent être morts, mais vous pouvez toujours sentir la lumière dans son âme.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I have the items requested. Craft me your trap that we may see these lands free.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生，所需物品已集齐。请为我制作陷阱，还此地自由。
translated_text: <hpage>I need something, make me your trap, and let me show you this land at liberty.
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>J'ai besoin de quelque chose, fais de moi ton piège, et laisse-moi te montrer cette terre en liberté.

original_en_text: T’was a good deed you did up above, dear one, saving me from them screeching flocks. Not seen the like of it in a long, long time.<page>I’ve returned with all sorts of new goodies, too. Let’s see if anything I’ve scavenged will fit your fancy.
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，多亏你把我从那些可怕的家伙手上救了出来。我好久遭遇过那样的危险了。<page>我还带了各种各样新鲜的好东西回来。来看看我搜罗到的货物有没有合你心意的。
translated_text: You did good there and saved me from the hand of the screaming sheep, and I was not afraid of you. I haven't seen anything like this for a long time.<page>I came back with a new one. Let's see if what I have chosen suits your taste.
secondary_translated_text: Tu as fait du bien là - bas, tu m'as sauvé de la main des brebis qui crient, et je ne t'ai pas craint. Je n'ai rien vu de pareil depuis longtemps.<page>Je suis revenue avec un nouveau. Voyons si ce que j'ai choisi correspond à votre goût.

original_en_text: Don’t think I ain’t see’in it, bellringer! A whole lotta helpin’ you’ve been up to, both here and down below!<page>S’a strange mantle you’re takin’ for yourself, seeing all them bugs saved and wishes promised.<hpage>You find it strange, sir? I’ve found some solace in the service, and the rewards received have proved a boon on my journey.<page>Aye! But it ain’t your place now, is it? I see well what you are, Weaver’n more! It’s below your station! You ain’t no common sort meant for carin’ on us low folk.<hpage>I could say the same for you, who still chooses to remain cowled. You continue to pose as only a simple pilgrim. Don’t you think it’s past time you ceased the performance?<page>Leave off, Old One! Permit a bug their small disguise! It’s been a pleasant thing to play simple. And I weren’t calling for change, even if you seem insistent on bringing it!<hpage>Change was unavoidable, sir, whether I arrived or not. The monarch stirs. Its threads stretch far. My presence only accelerates the inevitable.<page>So what’re you hopin’ for, eh? Planning to usurp, to perch above us all as queen? Build up our hopes only to string us all in your own beastly web? Such is the way of Weavers and gods both...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！别当我没看见！你在这里和下层当活菩萨呢！<page>披着救世主的皮，到处行侠仗义，很别扭吧？<hpage>先生觉得我别扭？帮助其他虫子让我获得了某种慰藉。当然，获得的报酬也能助我前行。<page>呵！可这不是你该干的！我看得出来，你有织者血统！屈尊来操心我们这些贱民的死活，太掉价！<hpage>那你扮成普通朝圣者，不也是在演戏？是时候摘掉伪装了吧？<page>该死！就不能让我活个清净吗？安安静静的普通日子不好过吗？非得去寻求变革！<hpage>变革不可避免，无论我来与否。圣堡之主已然有所行动，其丝线已遍及全境。我的到来不过是加速了这过程。<page>所以你到底图什么？想夺权篡位，成为新的女皇？先点燃我们的希望，然后再把我们困入网中？你们织者和神灵都这副德行……
translated_text: Don't think you haven't seen it, Bell Linger! Even if you are here, you will get a lot of help!<page>The coat you are wearing is a strange coat, and you will see that all the worms are saved, and your wishes will be fulfilled.<hpage>do you think this is strange? I have found solace in my service, and the rewards I have received attest to the gospel of my journey.<page>yes! yes! But that's not the situation now, is it? You know who you are, Weaver! Just below your place! I'm not an ordinary person who criticizes the lower classes.<hpage>I can say the same thing, but I still wear a scarf. You're just pretending to be a pilgrim. don't you think you should stop acting?<page>Run away, old man! Let them disguise themselves as little bugs! Just to play is a pleasure. I'm not asking for change, but even if I insist on it!<hpage>Change is inevitable, whether I arrive or not. The monarch was excited. The line goes far away. My presence accelerates what is inevitable.<page>what is your plan to take our throne? to bind us all in the net of our own beast? That's how the gods and gods do it.
secondary_translated_text: Ne pensez pas que vous l'avez vu, Bell Linger ! Même si vous êtes ici, vous aurez beaucoup d'aide !<page>Le manteau que vous portez est un manteau étrange, et vous verrez que tous les vers sont sauvés, et vos souhaits seront accomplis.<hpage>Tu crois que c'est étrange ? J'ai trouvé réconfort dans mon service, et les récompenses que j'ai reçues témoignent de l'évangile de mon voyage.<page>Oui ! Oui ! Mais ce n'est pas la situation maintenant, n'est-ce pas ? Tu sais qui tu es, Weaver ! Juste en dessous de votre place ! Je ne suis pas une personne ordinaire qui critique les classes inférieures.<hpage>Je peux dire la même chose, mais je porte toujours une écharpe. Tu fais semblant d'être un pèlerin. Tu ne crois pas que tu devrais arrêter d'agir ?<page>Fuis, vieillard ! Laissez-les se déguiser en petits bugs ! Le simple fait de jouer est un plaisir. Je ne demande pas un changement, mais même si j'insiste sur cela !<hpage>Le changement est inévitable, que je vienne ou non. Le monarque était excité. La ligne est loin. Ma présence accélère l'inévitable.<page>Quel est votre plan pour prendre notre trône ? pour nous lier tous dans le filet de notre propre bête ? C'est ainsi que les dieux et les dieux le font.

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best you think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！你最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望——这是非常危险的！
translated_text: By continuing to help, you will start inspiring others! Berlinger, you'd better seriously think about the impact you're having!<page>Too much hope will prove to be a dangerous thing, especially for all these bugs who have longed for it.
secondary_translated_text: En continuant à aider, vous commencerez à inspirer les autres ! Berlinger, tu ferais mieux de réfléchir sérieusement à l'impact que tu as !<page>Trop d'espoir s'avère être une chose dangereuse, surtout pour tous ces bugs qui l'ont désiré.

original_en_text: Now, why don’t you hurry back to the shrine and let them all know what a good job you’ve done?<page>There might be a few more goodies to gather up on my way back, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 现在，快回去替我报平安吧！<page>我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: Now, why not hurry back to the shrine and tell him how well you're doing? "<page>There might be some good things on the way home, and you won't have to walk around in the meantime. Blessings and farewell!
secondary_translated_text: Maintenant, pourquoi ne pas se dépêcher de retourner au sanctuaire et lui dire à quel point vous allez bien ? "<page>Il peut y avoir de bonnes choses sur le chemin du retour, et vous n'aurez pas à vous promener dans l'intervalle. Bénédictions et au revoir !

original_en_text: Simply forged, and simply styled. Designed to open all sorts of different locks, if they be basic enough.
original_zh_text: 锻造工艺粗糙，样式也朴素。但能打开各种不同的锁——只要锁芯别太复杂。
translated_text: Easy forging, easy molding. If it's basic enough, it's designed to open a variety of locks.
secondary_translated_text: Facile à forger, facile à mouler. S'il est assez basique, il est conçu pour ouvrir une variété de serrures.

original_en_text: Sister, sister! Let me confide in you! As I ascended the Citadel’s chambers to reach this place, I swear I heard the laughter of a child!<page>Wasn’t much more than an echo, and I confess me fear’s been playing awful tricks on me... and yet that voice still keeps ringing in my head.<page>Surely though, no bug so young and lively could survive within those heartless halls?
original_zh_text: 小姐！你且听我说！在圣堡殿堂上来此地的路上，我分明听到了幼虫的嬉笑声！<page>肯定是回声作祟，要么就是我吓出幻觉了……但那笑声一直在我脑子里萦绕。<page>这鬼地方哪可能有活着的幼虫？你说对吧！
translated_text: sister! sister! I will confide in you! I swore that when I entered the castle chamber and arrived at this place, I heard a child laughing.<page>Just an echo, I admit that fear plays a big part in me. But that voice is still in my head.<page>Of course, such a young and active insect can not survive in its ruthless hall?
secondary_translated_text: soeur ! soeur ! Je vais te confier ! J'ai juré que quand je suis entré dans la chambre du château et que je suis arrivé à cet endroit, j'ai entendu un enfant rire.<page>Juste un écho, j'admets que la peur joue un grand rôle en moi, mais cette voix est toujours dans ma tête.<page>Bien sûr, un insecte aussi jeune et actif ne peut-il pas survivre dans son hall impitoyable ?

original_en_text: Sister, you seen ‘em out there? Our new champion, that golden knight stalking the Citadel’s crumbling halls?<page>Tall, righteous bug. Not much for conversing. Still! I’d be long dead if not for their appearance.<page>And I ain’t the only one. Others have spoken of the knight’s timely deeds and rare bravery.<page>We’re desperate for any protection we can get, and that gleaming champion’s been offering their aid almost as much as you yourself.
original_zh_text: 嘿，小姐，瞧见没？那位在圣堡摇摇欲坠的大厅里巡逻的金甲骑士！<page>高大正直，威风凛凛，不太爱说话。不过！要不是他，我早没命了！<page>不光是我！好多朝圣者都说曾被他及时搭救。<page>现在大伙就指望你和那位英雄护着咱了。
translated_text: Sister, did you see it there? Our new champion, the golden knight wandering the crumbling halls of the castle?<page>He is tall and doesn't talk much about fairness. Still! If it weren't for them, they would have been dead long ago.<page>Not only me. Others spoke of the knight's timely actions and rare courage.<page>We desperately need all the protection we can, and this glorious champion has provided us with as much support as you have.
secondary_translated_text: Sœur, l'avez-vous vu là ? Notre nouveau champion, le chevalier d'or errant dans les salles en ruines du château ?<page>Il est grand et ne parle pas beaucoup de justice. Quiet ! S'il n'y avait pas eu eux, ils seraient morts depuis longtemps.<page>D'autres ont parlé des actions opportunes et du courage rare du chevalier.<page>Nous avons désespérément besoin de toute la protection que nous pouvons, et ce glorieux champion nous a fourni autant de soutien que vous.

original_en_text: If you’re going to keep skulkin’ around here while I work, you may as well buy something. Take a look dear one, don’t be shy!
original_zh_text: 如果你打算在我干活的时候一直偷偷摸摸地在这儿晃悠，那你还不如找我买点东西。来看看吧，亲爱的，别害羞！
translated_text: If you want to hide here while I'm working, you better buy something, honey, look, don't be ashamed! "
secondary_translated_text: Si tu veux te cacher ici pendant que je travaille, tu ferais mieux d'acheter quelque chose, chéri, regarde, n'aie pas honte ! "

original_en_text: And last, as the base, seek a weapon of Weavers past. Should still be one left, down there in their largest nest, a snare to set a rune’o searing Silk. Our own trap’ll be woven tight about it.
original_zh_text: 最后是陷阱的基底部分，去找到古织者的工具——陷阱设置器，它可以用来设下灼烧灵丝的符文。<page>应该还剩一个，就在织者最大的巢穴里。我们的陷阱将以它为核心进行制作。
translated_text: Finally, as a base, we look for weapons from Weaver's past. There should be one more trap left to get the Rune's scorched silk into the biggest nest. Our own traps revolve around it.
secondary_translated_text: Enfin, comme base, nous recherchons des armes du passé de Weaver. Il devrait y avoir un piège de plus pour faire entrer la soie brûlée de la Rune dans le plus grand nid. Nos propres pièges tournent autour d'eux.

original_en_text: Admit it! You done it! You shifty li’l bell-runger!<hpage>You have chosen a curious place to rest, sir. Do you perhaps know something of this shrine and its companions in the lands below?<page>Oh, so you ask funny questions as well as cutting bells free, eh? You certainly ain’t a pilgrim, but you’re clearly not of the Choir either. No! I know exactly what you are...<page>A bell-ringing lout! A weirdo! Don’t you realise what you’ve done, waking that shrine back up?<page>That bell has rung out far and wide! The wretched and the lost will have heard its call. They’ll be making their way here now.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! You can help me deal with all the dirty little pilgrims and desperate scavengers who turn up.
original_zh_text: 承认吧！就是你干的！你这莽撞的敲钟者！<hpage>先生，你选了个有趣的地方歇脚。莫非知晓这处钟殿与下方各处钟殿的关联？<page>哈！又会问怪问题又会乱敲钟，既非朝圣者也不像圣咏团……我算看明白了——<page>你就是个扰我清梦的怪胎！知道唤醒这座钟殿会引来什么吗？<page>迷途的朝圣者和食腐者都会循钟声而来！<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙对付那些脏兮兮的家伙！
translated_text: Let's admit it! you did it! You are a cunning little bell messenger!<hpage>You chose a strange place. Do you know of this temple and its companions in the land below?<page>You've got some interesting questions and a free phone call. You are not a pilgrim, but you are not a member of the choir. No! I know very well who you are.<page>Stupid bell ringing. That's weird! do you know what i did to get the temple back?<page>The bells in the distance have rang! The lost and the lost hear its call. i'm here right now.<page>What you did, what you did, what you did. Come back quickly, you idiot! You can help me to all the dirty little pilgrims and desperate scavengers.
secondary_translated_text: Admetons-le ! Tu l'as fait ! Vous êtes un petit messager de cloche sournois !<hpage>Tu as choisi un endroit étrange. Connaissez-vous ce temple et ses compagnons dans la terre ci-dessous ?<page>Vous avez des questions intéressantes et un appel téléphonique gratuit. Vous n'êtes pas un pèlerin, mais vous n'êtes pas membre de la chorale. Non ! Je sais très bien qui tu es.<page>Bell stupide sonne. C'est bizarre ! Savez-vous ce que j'ai fait pour récupérer le temple ?<page>Les cloches au loin ont sonné ! Les perdus et les perdus entendent son appel. Je suis ici maintenant.<page>Ce que vous avez fait, ce que vous avez fait, ce que vous avez fait. Reviens vite, espèce d'idiot ! Vous pouvez m'aider à tous les petits pèlerins sales et les charniers désespérés.

original_en_text: Oi! What’s this? Suddenly havin’ second thoughts? For sure it’s a frightful thing to attempt, but you’ve already put in all the leg work!<page>She up top’ll already be sensin’ your goal, vague-like maybe, but there ain’t no worth to backin’ out now.
original_zh_text: 喂！这就反悔了？虽然这计划确实骇人，但你都已经走到这一步了！<page>顶上那位早就隐隐约约地感应到了你的企图，现在退缩太迟了！
translated_text: Hey! what is this? sudden change of heart? Sure, it's scary to try it, but you're putting in all the physical effort!<page>She already feels you've been there, maybe like Mary, but it's not worth giving up now.
secondary_translated_text: Hey ! Qu 'est-ce que c'est ? Changement soudain de cœur ? Bien sûr, c'est effrayant de l'essayer, mais vous mettez tout l'effort physique !<page>Elle sent déjà que vous avez été là, peut - être comme Mary, mais cela ne vaut pas la peine d'abandonner maintenant.

original_en_text: Stretch a spool out nice and long with this fine-wrought tool. The perfect purchase if you’re planning to hoard a lot of Silk for yourself!
original_zh_text: 这件制作精良的工具能拓展你的灵丝轴容量。如果你打算为自己囤积大量灵丝，这件绝对是必买！
translated_text: Use this excellent tool to expand the scroll. If you plan to buy a large amount of silk yourself, this is the perfect purchase!
secondary_translated_text: Utilisez cet excellent outil pour développer le défilement. Si vous prévoyez d'acheter une grande quantité de soie vous-même, c'est l'achat parfait !

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望，这是非常危险的！
translated_text: By continuing to help, you will start inspiring others! Berlinger, think seriously about the impact you're having!<page>Too much hope will prove to be a dangerous thing, especially for all these bugs who have longed for it.
secondary_translated_text: En continuant à aider, vous commencerez à inspirer les autres ! Berlinger, réfléchissez sérieusement à l'impact que vous avez !<page>Trop d'espoir s'avère être une chose dangereuse, surtout pour tous ces bugs qui l'ont désiré.

original_en_text: Ooohh... What new horror now besets us?<page>Is this fresh punishment for our sins, or yet another test to prove our faith?<hpage>It is neither, good bug. In this disaster you bear no blame.<hpage>Hold close to your companions, and I will work swift to see this madness stilled.
original_zh_text: 噢……现在又是什么新的灾祸降临到我们头上了？<page>这是对我们罪孽的报应，还是又一次考验我们信仰的试炼？<hpage>都不是。在这场灾厄中，你并无任何过错。<hpage>别离开你的同伴，我会尽快让这场狂乱平息下来。
translated_text: What kind of fear is plaguing us right now?<page>Is this a new punishment for our sins, or is it a test of faith?<hpage>Both are good bugs. There is no responsibility in this disaster.<hpage>Hold on tight to your companion, and I will end this madness as soon as I can.
secondary_translated_text: Quel genre de peur nous afflige actuellement ?<page>Est-ce un nouveau châtiment pour nos péchés, ou est-ce un test de foi ?<hpage>Les deux sont de bons bugs. Il n'y a aucune responsabilité dans ce désastre.<hpage>Raccroche-toi à ton compagnon, et je mettrai fin à cette folie dès que je peux.

original_en_text: For the base, we’ll be needin’ a weapon of Weavers past. Search down low, aside the paths of bone, inside their largest nest. S’a snare device, one to set a rune’o searing Silk.
original_zh_text: 陷阱的基底部分需要用到一件古织者的工具——可以设下符文的陷阱设置器。往底层搜寻，就在满是骨头的道路旁，织者最大的巢穴里。
translated_text: We need weapons from Weaver's past. In their largest nest, they look down on the path of bones. It is a trap device that sets the runes to burn silk.
secondary_translated_text: Nous avons besoin d'armes du passé de Weaver. Dans leur plus grand nid, ils regardent vers le bas sur le chemin des os. C'est un piège qui met les runes à brûler la soie.

original_en_text: I swear I heard it, sister... That laugh! It almost sounded like they were enjoying themself...
original_zh_text: 小姐，我真没幻听……那笑声……听着像是它们在嬉戏玩乐一样……
translated_text: I swear I heard that, sister... That smile! You seem to be enjoying yourself...
secondary_translated_text: J'ai juré que j'ai entendu ça, ma soeur... Ce sourire ! Vous semblez vous amuser...

original_en_text: Hold this while makin’ music and you’ll soon hear its function. Amplifies song, it does! Sends it out full and bright. Ideal if you’re ever planning on performing for a crowd.
original_zh_text: 演奏时握着这件宝贝，你就能很快体会到它的作用。它能放大乐声，让声音饱满又响亮。要是你打算登台表演，这东西再合适不过了
translated_text: If you hold it when you make music, you can immediately hear its function. Upgraded this song, really! It makes a full, bright sound. If you're planning a show for the crowd, this is the perfect option for you.
secondary_translated_text: Si vous le tenez quand vous faites de la musique, vous pouvez immédiatement entendre sa fonction. J'ai amélioré cette chanson, vraiment ! Il produit un son plein et lumineux. Si vous prévoyez un spectacle pour la foule, c'est l'option idéale pour vous.

original_en_text: How about we get your loose beads all strung up safe? I’ll pinch a few for their braiding, but that’s surely worth it for the peace of mind.
original_zh_text: 我来帮你把零散的念珠穿起来，做成便携的链子怎么样？收点手工费不过分吧？图个心安嘛！
translated_text: What if you bundled all the loose beads securely? I'll have some knitted and weaved, but for peace of mind, it's definitely worth it.
secondary_translated_text: Et si vous regroupez tous les perles lâches en toute sécurité ? Je vais en avoir un peu tricoté et tissé, mais pour la tranquillité d'esprit, cela en vaut vraiment la peine.

original_en_text: Ooh, I’m glad I wriggled my way over here! What a bounty’s been laid out by our benefactors, those generous Conductors! Giants amongst bugs they are, all-seeing and kind!<page>It’s beautiful here, and goodies are everywhere. Only enough for one though, deary, so don’t be greedy! You know I got here first. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 啊哈！幸亏我一路摸到这儿来了！咱们的恩主——慷慨的指挥家们，可真是留下了丰厚的赏赐啊！他们全视全知，又心地善良！<page>这儿可真美，到处都是好东西。不过嘛，亲爱的，这些东西只够我拿哦，所以别贪心！你该懂得先来后到。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: Oh, glad I turned around! What a great return our donors, generous conductors, will give! They are giants among insects, omniscient and kind.<page>It's beautiful, and there's good stuff everywhere. Honey, this is enough to eat alone! I came first. Blessings, goodbye!
secondary_translated_text: Heureusement que je me suis tourné ! Quel grand retour donneront nos donateurs, généreux conducteurs ! Ils sont géants parmi les insectes, omniscients et gentils.<page>C'est beau, et il y a de bonnes choses partout. C'est assez pour manger seul ! Je suis arrivé en premier. Bénédictions, au revoir !

original_en_text: You stay close, sister. Them halls beside are crawling with haunted husks.<page>Wandering will only bring death, pointed and painful!
original_zh_text: 小姐，你跟紧点。旁边的那些大厅里到处都是被丝咒附身的躯壳。<page>四处乱走只会带来痛苦的死亡。
translated_text: Hold tight, sister. A nearby hall is full of ghostly shells.<page>Wanderings only bring death, sharpening and pain!
secondary_translated_text: Tenez-vous bien, soeur. Une salle voisine est pleine de coquilles fantômes.<page>Les errances n'apportent que la mort, l'aiguisement et la douleur !

original_en_text: Have you done it yet, bellringer? Wriggled deep? Discovered the depths of obsession that brought this place so low?<hpage>If you speak of this Citadel and its Silk, Caretaker, then yes, I now know the start of it. <hpage>In the ward down below, I saw it clear, the hollowed husks, and the many torturous implements... machines to instill a bug with thread, that would see their life extended.<page>Aye! That’s it, in part! But there’s more scale to it than all that. Just think of’em greedily shoving the Silk into their shells, the madness that overcame them, eternal life for mortal bugs! Then think on how long it’s all gone on...<hpage>...The children born of them, and all the pilgrims after... The Silk has seeded deep into this kingdom’s shells, generations deep...<hpage>No wonder Pharloom’s bugs proved such easy prey for that haunted thread. It had only to seek for itself to reach them.<page>Ho ho! Now you’re seein’ it, bellringer! These poor pilgrims, all born bound to the cruel system of our world, now stricken in its new cursed web.<page>You at least are free from it. And free to shake it all up... if’n that’s your choosing.
original_zh_text: 事情办成了吗，敲钟者？找出那些让圣堡堕落的疯狂执念没？<hpage>若是指圣堡的丝咒，是的，我已知晓其根源。<hpage>下层病房里尽是空壳，以及无数刑具般的器械……那些向甲壳灌注丝线延续生命的机器。<page>没错！但远不止如此！想想他们贪婪吞食灵丝的模样，凡虫妄图永生引发的癫狂！再想想这持续了多少世代……<hpage>……他们的子嗣，后来的朝圣者……灵丝早已深植于这个王国的甲壳内，代代相传……<hpage>难怪纺络的虫子会轻易沦为丝咒的猎物，那些邪丝只需稍加引诱就能侵蚀他们。<page>哈！现在你算看透了！这些可怜虫生来就被束缚在这个世界的残酷体制里，如今又陷进新的诅咒之网。<page>至少你是自由的，自由得足以颠覆这一切……若这是你的选择。
translated_text: did you do it, belllinger? shaking deeply? Did you discover the depth of attachment that makes this place so low?<hpage>If you're talking about this castle and silk and guards, yes. Now I know where it all started.<hpage>In the lower ward, the hollowed-out shells and torture instruments could be clearly seen. The machine uses threads to inject errors and extend its life.<page>yes! yes! One part!! But the scale was greater than that. Think of cramming silk into a shell with greed and beating it out of desperation. And think about how long this situation has been going on.<hpage>... The children they bore, and the pilgrims who followed. Silk is already deeply rooted in the shell of this kingdom, and has been passed down from generation to generation.<hpage>No wonder Pharaoh's worms can easily be eaten by ghost threads. All you have to do is look for yourself to reach them.<page>what?! You see, Bel Linger! Poor pilgrims born bound to the cruel system of our world are now trapped in this new cursed network, and they are now in the same place.<page>At least we can get rid of it. If it is your choice, you are free to change everything.
secondary_translated_text: Tu l'as fait, Bellinger ? Trembler profondément ? Avez-vous découvert la profondeur d'attachement qui rend cet endroit si bas ?<hpage>Si vous parlez de ce château et de la soie et des gardes, oui. Je sais maintenant où tout a commencé.<hpage>Dans le quartier inférieur, les obus creusés et les instruments de torture étaient clairement visibles. La machine utilise des threads pour injecter des erreurs et prolonger sa vie.<page>Oui ! Oui ! Une partie ! ! Mais l'échelle était plus grande que cela. Pensez à enfoncer la soie dans une coquille avec cupidité et à la battre par désespoir. Réfléchissez à combien de temps cette situation dure.<hpage>... Les enfants qu ' ils ont portés, et les pèlerins qui les ont suivis. La soie est déjà profondément enracinée dans la coquille de ce royaume, et a été transmise de génération en génération.<hpage>Pas étonnant que les vers de Pharaon puissent facilement être mangés par les fils fantômes. Tout ce que vous avez à faire, c'est de vous chercher pour les atteindre.<page>Quoi ? ! Vous voyez, Bel Linger. Pauvres pèlerins nés liés au système cruel de notre monde sont maintenant piégés dans ce nouveau réseau maudit, et ils sont maintenant au même endroit.<page>Au moins, nous pouvons nous débarrasser de cela. Si c'est votre choix, vous êtes libre de tout changer.

original_en_text: Well, well, if it isn’t my very own shadow, the clever little red-cloak! You still following me around, trying to pinch away some of the goodies I sniff out?<hpage>You mistake my intent, ma’am, somewhat ungenerously. The pilgrims of the settlement below were worried by your long absence. It was on their behalf that I tracked you, again.<page>Is that so? What a worrying bunch of busybodies they are! I’m still able to fend for meself!<page>Hmph... and yet, perhaps ‘tis a warm thing that I remain in their thoughts so. I hadn’t expected that. And I can’t deny that you too have done me a good turn once more.<page>That awful flock almost had me, truth be told, and I still have to wonder at your intentions, dear one... but bless you, all the same!
original_zh_text: 啧啧，这不是小红斗篷嘛！还在惦记着老婆子我找到的的宝贝？<hpage>女士，你误会了。是庇护所的虫子们担心你的安危，我才再次前来找你。<page>是这样吗？瞎操心！老婆子我纵横圣堡的时候他们都还是虫卵呢！<page>不过……被惦记的感觉倒也不坏。这次算我又欠你一份情。<page>说实话，那群可怕的家伙差点就抓住我了，而你……不管怎样，还是要感谢你！
translated_text: Well, well, if it's not my own shadow, a wise red cape! You're still stalking me and trying to kill the good thing that smells me?<hpage>You misunderstand my intentions and are not a bit generous. The pilgrims of the settlements below are worried about your long absence. I will follow you again. "<page>is that right? They are a group of people who really interfere! I still feed myself! "<page>um... But to stay in their thoughts in this way may be a warm thing for me, and I'm not sure what I'm doing. I didn't think this would happen. I cannot deny that you have a favour for me. "<page>To be honest, that dreadful sheep has almost caught me, I still want to know your intentions, dear but bless!
secondary_translated_text: Eh bien, eh bien, si ce n'est pas mon propre ombre, une savie cape rouge ! Tu es toujours en train de me traquer et d'essayer de tuer la bonne chose qui sent de moi ?<hpage>Vous avez mal compris mes intentions et vous n'êtes pas un peu généreux. Les pèlerins des colonies ci-dessous sont inquiets de votre longue absence. Je vous suivrai de nouveau. "<page>Est-ce correct ? C'est un groupe de gens qui s'interfèrent vraiment ! Je me nourris moi-même ! "<page>Umm... Mais rester dans leurs pensées de cette façon peut être une chose chaleureuse pour moi, et je ne suis pas sûr de ce que je fais. Je ne pensais pas que cela arriverait. Je ne peux pas nier que vous avez une faveur pour moi. "<page>Pour être honnête, cette mouton terrible m'a presque attrapé, je veux encore connaître tes intentions, chère mais bénie !

original_en_text: Looking for goodies of your own, dear one? You’d do well to avoid the dark vaults near here. They say the keepers inside were jealous hoarders even before the silken curse came down.<hpage>You have more familiarity with the Citadel than most, madam. How long have you spent here, surviving amongst the haunted corridors?<page>Oh, long enough. S’not such a bad lot, all told. The memories of my pilgrimage have all faded now, but a life spent in the Citadel’s golden halls was all I ever wished for.<page>And lo and behold, my humble wish was granted! Certainly, the place might be a bit past its prime, but it’d be churlish of me to complain now, wouldn’t it?
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，你也在找好东西吗？你最好避开这附近阴暗的书库。据说在丝咒降临之前，里面的管理员就已经是些抠门的守财奴了。<hpage>女士，你比大多数虫都更熟悉圣堡。这被诅咒的地方生存，肯定也不是件易事吧？你在这儿待了多久了？<page>唔，待了有够久了。总的来说，也不算太差。当初朝圣时的记忆如今已经模糊，但在这金色圣堡度过一生，这就是老婆子我的毕生所求。<page>你瞧啊，我这小小的愿望已经实现啦！当然，这地方或许已经过了鼎盛时期，但现在要是我还抱怨，那就太不识好歹了，不是吗？
translated_text: Are you looking for something good for yourself? Dark vault rooms nearby are better avoided. It is said that even before the curse of the silk arrived, the keeper inside was a jealous hoarder.<hpage>You know the woman in the castle better than most people. How long have you been living in this haunted house?<page>Oh, enough is enough. In general, he's not a bad guy. All the memories of the pilgrimage were gone, but it was the life I had spent in the golden rooms of the castle that I wanted.<page>A small wish was granted! Sure, this place may have been past its prime, but it's rude to complain now, isn't it?
secondary_translated_text: Cherchez-vous quelque chose de bon pour vous-même ? Les chambres sombres à proximité sont mieux évitées. On dit que même avant l'arrivée de la malédiction de la soie, le gardien à l'intérieur était un trésorier jaloux.<hpage>Vous connaissez la femme du château mieux que la plupart des gens. Depuis combien de temps vivez-vous dans cette maison hantée ?<page>Oh, assez, c'est assez. En général, il n'est pas un mauvais gars. Tous les souvenirs du pèlerinage avaient disparu, mais c'était la vie que j'avais passée dans les chambres dorées du château que je voulais.<page>Un petit vœu a été exaucé ! Bien sûr, cet endroit a peut - être dépassé son apogée, mais il est impoli de se plaindre maintenant, n'est-ce pas ?

original_en_text: Part of an ancient mask, or a fractured shard of someone’s visage? With the full thing, you’d be better able to protect your shell.
original_zh_text: 古老面甲的一部分？还是谁的面部残片？要是能凑齐整套，肯定能更好地保护你的甲壳。
translated_text: Part of an ancient mask, or a fragment of someone's face. It is complete and can protect the shell better.
secondary_translated_text: Une partie d'un masque ancien, ou un fragment du visage de quelqu 'un. Il est complet et peut mieux protéger la coquille.

original_en_text: What a calamity has befallen our holy Citadel! I ain’t never seen anything like it in my long life.<page>Times like this, we must be sure to help each other. Dig deep, dear one, I’ll be needing a lot of rosaries to survive what’s comin’!
original_zh_text: 圣堡这次真是大难临头了！老婆子我活了这么久，这阵仗还是头回见！<page>这种时候，我们一定要相互帮助。帮帮忙，亲爱的，为了挺过即将到来的难关，我需要很多念珠！
translated_text: What calamity has befallen the holy castle! I have never seen anything like this in my long life.<page>At times like these, we need to help each other. Dear friends, please dig deep. We need a lot of rosaries to get through what's coming!
secondary_translated_text: Quelle calamité a frappé le saint château ! Je n'ai jamais vu quelque chose de pareil dans ma longue vie.<page>Dans des moments comme celui-ci, nous devons nous aider les uns les autres. Chers amis, plongez en profondeur. Nous avons besoin de beaucoup de rosaires pour passer à travers ce qui vient !

original_en_text: All your work, and look! They keep arrivin’. It’s bugs aplenty up here now. Hapless, weak, but alive they are!<hpage>More scared than weak, they seem to me. It is heartening knowing these few have survived safe for your care.<page>That’s your work, bellringer! Not mine. Ringin’ and helpin’! Hope they recognise your efforts, ‘cause I ain’t providing much, and I ain’t one for fighting if that Choir and their pins ever come callin’.
original_zh_text: 全是你折腾的后果！现在这儿挤满虫子了！又蠢又弱，畏畏缩缩地苟活！<hpage>更像是吓坏了，才显得羸弱。还得多亏有你在这儿照顾他们。<page>喂！别跟我扯上关系！这都是你干的好事，敲钟者！我可不会帮忙打架——要是圣咏团找上门，你自己扛！
translated_text: Look at all the works! They continue to arrive. There are many bugs now. They are weak and weak, but still alive.<hpage>They seem to be more afraid than weak. Glad to know that they survived safely under your care. "<page>That's your job, Bell Linger! Not my bell and help! I don't offer much, so I want you to acknowledge your efforts. Even if the choir and their badges are called, I will not fight. "
secondary_translated_text: Regardez tous les travaux ! Ils continuent d'arriver. Il y a beaucoup de bugs maintenant. Ils sont faibles et faibles, mais ils sont encore vivants.<hpage>Ils semblent avoir plus peur que faible. Je suis heureux de savoir qu 'ils ont survécu en toute sécurité sous vos soins.
